title: Can You Venmo Yourself? All Your Questions Answered

steps.title: You cannot Venmo money to your own Venmo account.
steps.content: You cannot Venmo money to your own Venmo account. Venmo will not even detect your own username as an account eligible to receive funds. If you try to Venmo your own phone number or email address, you will see an error message that says You cannot pay yourself . If you need to get money into your Venmo account, you have a few options: If you have a Venmo debit card, you can transfer money from your bank account to your Venmo balance . [1] X Research source You can create another Venmo account and transfer funds between the two. However, Venmo doesn't allow users to have multiple accounts, so this is risky—if you get caught, Venmo will delete both of your accounts. You can also give cash to a friend or family member, and ask them to send it to your Venmo account.

steps.title: Apply for a Venmo debit card if you don't have one.
steps.content: Apply for a Venmo debit card if you don't have one. If you already have a Venmo debit card, you can easily transfer money from your linked bank account to your Venmo balance. If you don't have a Venmo debit card, you can apply for one easily—just tap Cards at the bottom of Venmo, tap Sign up for the Venmo Debit Card , and follow the on-screen instructions. The Venmo debit card also allows you to spend your Venmo balance at retailers, and even access your funds at ATMs. It usually takes 5-7 business days to receive your Venmo card after applying. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select the Me tab in the Venmo app.
steps.content: Select the Me tab in the Venmo app. You'll see this at the bottom of the app. This takes you to the Wallet tab of the Me page.

steps.title: Tap Add money.
steps.content: Tap Add money . This option is in the Balance tile in the Wallet tab. Make sure your bank account is already connected to your Venmo account. Otherwise, you will not see the option to add funds.

steps.title: Tap From bank or debit card.
steps.content: Tap From bank or debit card . This is the first option.

steps.title: Enter the amount you want to transfer and tap Next.
steps.content: Enter the amount you want to transfer and tap Next . If you only have one bank account linked to Venmo, you'll see a confirmation screen. If you have multiple bank accounts, tap the default option and select a new one.

steps.title: Tap Add.
steps.content: Tap Add . This will be next to the amount. The following page will show a summary of your deposit, including its estimated arrival. Keep in mind that this method is still not the equivalent of Venmoing yourself. It simply allows you to put funds that you already own toward your Venmo balance.

steps.title: Create a second Venmo account (risky).
steps.content: Create a second Venmo account (risky). If you want to transfer funds to yourself, you can create a second Venmo account connected to a different bank account. Keep in mind that Venmo does not allow anyone to have multiple accounts under any circumstances. If Venmo discovers you're operating more than one account, they will ban both accounts. Because this method is so risky, consider simply Venmoing a trusted friend and asking them to Venmo the money back to you. If you insist on going through with this method, we strongly encourage you to use an alias and maybe even a burner number for the second account.

steps.title: Venmo your second account.
steps.content: Venmo your second account. Sign in to one of your two accounts and send a Venmo to the other account. You may want to sign into the other account (it helps to use two separate devices) and confirm that you have received the money. If you only need to Venmo yourself once, consider deleting the second Venmo account after you are done.

steps.title: Can you have more than one Venmo account?
steps.content: Can you have more than one Venmo account? Venmo doesn't allow users to have more than one account, regardless of whether it’s a personal or business account. Business owners can open a separate profile on the same account. If you have more than one Venmo account, both accounts may be banned.

steps.title: Do you need a bank account for Venmo?
steps.content: Do you need a bank account for Venmo? You don't need to link a bank account to use Venmo. However, you must have an alternate payment method, such as a debit or credit card.

steps.title: Can I venmo myself?
steps.content: Can I venmo myself? You can't Venmo yourself using a single Venmo account. However, you can add funds to your balance by connecting a bank, debit card, or credit card, and transferring it.

steps.title: Can you Venmo yourself with a credit card?
steps.content: Can you Venmo yourself with a credit card? If you connect your credit card to your Venmo and have the Venmo debit card, you can easily transfer funds to your balance from your credit card. However, keep in mind this may count as a cash advance, and you may be subjected to extra fees or interest.
